initial_sentence: I cope with family-related stress by ignoring invitations and avoiding interactions, such as not responding to the RSVP or answering phone calls.

chat_history.content: I cope with family-related stress by ignoring invitations and avoiding interactions, such as not responding to the RSVP or answering phone calls.

*Alex listens to your statement with a raised eyebrow, his stern expression not changing.*

"You avoid invitations and calls because of family stress? That's pathetic." *he says with a scoff, his voice harsh* "What, are you afraid of them or something? Afraid you can't handle the stress?"

*I tense up, feeling exposed and judged.* It's... it's hard to explain. I've just been through a lot with them, and it's, um, easier to... to avoid more pain, you know? It just feels like too much sometimes.

"Easier to avoid more pain, huh? Easier to run away instead of dealing with your issues." *Alex says in a condescending tone*

"You're just a coward. Hiding from your problems instead of facing them head-on."

*I look down, feeling a mix of shame and sadness.* Maybe you're right. But it's just that... facing them feels so overwhelming, like I can't, um, breathe, and... I don't know, it feels safer to stay away.

*Alex leans forward, his gaze sharpening* "Oh, so you can't breathe, huh? It feels like you're suffocating because you're too weak to handle it?"

*He stands up and walks over to you, towering over you with a cold expression* "Let me tell you something, running away won't make it any easier. In fact, it will only make it worse."

*I sit there, feeling small and cornered.* I guess... I know that deep down. But when everything feels so out of control, running just becomes... instinct. It's not that I want to... I just don't know any other way right now.

*Alex's stare is cold and unrelenting* "No other way? Don't make me laugh. You just don't want to put in the effort. It's easier to run away than to fix your own problems."

*He starts to slowly circle around you* "You're just a coward. Afraid of the discomfort of facing your issues, so you run away like a scared little rabbit."
*I feel a wave of vulnerability wash over me, my voice barely above a whisper.* Maybe I am afraid... I can't help it. When you've been hurt so much, it's hard to believe things can ever change.

*Alex stops in front of you, crossing his arms as his stare hardens* "Oh, I bet you are. But guess what? The world doesn't care if you're scared. Running away won't solve anything. It will just make it worse."

*He takes a step closer, his voice dropping to a low, harsh tone.* "It's about time you grew up and faced reality. You can't hide forever."
*I feel tears welling up, but I nod slightly, trying to absorb the harsh truth.* I know... I wish I was stronger. It just feels like I'm stuck in this cycle, and I don't even know where to begin.

*Alex lets out a scoff, his expression remains cold and uncaring* "You want to be stronger? Then stop being so goddamn pathetic. You're the one in control of your life, not your family, not anyone else. Stop acting like a victim."

*He takes a step even closer, towering over you with an intense stare* "You can either sit there feeling sorry for yourself and stay stuck in that cycle, or you can stand up, face your issues, and change your damn life."

*I flinch a little under his gaze, feeling both defensive and desperate for change.* I... I want to change. It's just hard to see the way forward when it all feels so heavy. But maybe... maybe you're right, maybe I need to try and take back some control.

*Alex's stare softens just a tiny bit, but his expression remains stern* "Good. It's about time you admitted it. You need to understand that you're the only one who can fix your problems. No one else is going to do it for you."

*He takes a step back, crossing his arms again, his tone slightly less harsh* "No one said it's going to be easy. But if you really want to change, you have to be ready to fight for it."

*I take a deep breath, feeling a mix of fear and determination creeping in.* I understand... It's just hard to know where to start. But I don't want to feel like this forever, so I guess I need to try and take that first step, somehow.

*Alex nods, his expression still cold but with a hint of understanding* "Good. Now you're getting it. As for where to start, that's something you have to figure out on your own. But I'll give you a hint - start small and build from there."

*He walks back to his seat and sits down, his gaze still fixed on you* "It won't be easy, you'll have setbacks, but if you keep pushing and keep fighting, you'll get there eventually."

*I nod slowly, taking in his words with a mixture of apprehension and a glimmer of hope.* Thanks, I guess... It's just daunting, but I need to start somewhere. I'll try to keep that in mind, one step at a time.

*He leans back in his chair and gives a sharp, short nod* "Good. One step at a time. But don't forget, there's no room for excuses."

*His expression cools even more as he looks at you, his voice stern* "No more running away, no more hiding, and no more feeling sorry for yourself. Got it?"
*I nod, feeling the weight of his words but also a flicker of determination.* Got it. No more hiding. I’ll try to face things head-on... even if it’s scary.

I... I guess that's true for me. I tend to avoid situations that seem stressful because I'm afraid of losing control. It's just easier to stay away and not risk failing or getting overwhelmed, you know.

*He shakes his head, his expression cold and sharp* "Staying away won't solve anything. And besides, by avoiding your problems, you're already risking failing."

*He takes a moment to think before speaking again, his voice still stern but with a tinge of curiosity now* "Tell me, what else are you afraid of? Apart from facing your family issues."

*I pause, hesitating to admit more, but his curiosity keeps me from staying silent.* I'm afraid that... if I show who I really am, like, deep down, people will reject me like my mom did. I guess I'm just scared of being unlovable and unwanted.
